alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 11 at 3:54PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Central Henderson County, North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Nuisance to Minor flooding of low-lying areas including farmland, parks, greenways, nurseries, low-water crossings, golf courses, and low-lying roadways adjacent to streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 342 PM EST, Storm-total rainfall of 2-4" within the Mud Creek watershed of central Henderson County resulted in significant rises along Mud Creek and its tributaries. Heavy rainfall has ended across the area and the floodwave is moving through the Hendersonville area. Mud Creek has crested at 9.54 feet between 2 and 3 pm at Erkwood Dr and will crest downstream over the next couple of hours. However, Mud Creek remains above Minor Flood Stage and continues to impact farmland, nurseries, and golf courses near Crail Farm Rd, Middleton Rd, Erkwood Dr, and Kanuga Rd as well as the Oklawaha Greenway. It will take several more hours for Mud Creek to recede below bankfull or Action/Advisory Stage. Therefore, flooding impacts will continue but gradually improve into the evening hours. The Flood Advisory will remain in effect until the stream falls below Action/Advisory Stage. - Some locations that may continue to experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Dupont State Forest, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock, Crab Creek and Dana. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
